clinical_study.brief_title: Autologous Killer Cell Therapy in Colon Cancer Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Efficacy of ex Vivo Activated and Expanded Autologous Cytokine-induced Killer Cells for Colon Cancer Patients

collaborator.agency: Ministry of Health and Medical Education
Cell-based Therapies Research Center, Digestive Diseases Research Institute, Tehran University of Medical Sciences, Iran

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to evaluate the safety and efficacy of activated and expanded autologous cytokine-killer cells in controlling disease recurrence in patients with colon cancer. 20 patients with confirmed colon carcinoma who have had complete resection of primary lesions will be randomly assigned into two groups. Patients in both groups will receive the same therapeutic regimen as usual. Patients in one group additionally will be treated with several infusions of autologous killer cells that had been previously prepared from peripheral blood.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety of administering CIK cells plus chemotherapy
primary_outcome.description: Patients will be continually assessed for unexpected adverse events or unexpected early mortality 30 days post infusion
The time from treatment initiation day to first documented progressive disease or death due to disease.
the time from randomization until cancer progression, not including death.

secondary_outcome.description: The length of time that the patients are still alive at a defined period of time after treatment

arm_group.description: Patients who receive their routine treatment (chemotherapy, radiation therapy) + Cytokine-induced killer cell infusion
Patients who receive routine treatments only (chemotherapy, radiation therapy)

intervention.description: Routine treatments for colon cancer patients according to their stage

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients with histologically confirmed colorectal cancer at stage II/III
2. Male patient aged at 40-60 years' old
3. undergone prior complete resection of the primary lesions (colorectal cancer)
4. ECOG performance status 0-2
5. Adequate cardiac/renal/hepatic function
6. Adequate bone marrow function (blood cell count)
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Female patients
2. Patients that have received prior chemotherapy or immune cell therapy
3. Patients that have previously participated in another clinical trial
4. History of positive test result for HIV, HBV, HCV, HTLV-1, syphilis
5. Presence of Active infections
6. Patients with immunodeficiencies, autoimmunities or sever allergies
7. Receiving immunosuppressive regimens
